intro: Chamaefistula tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima fiddlewood, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has woody stems and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
